item.title: Ticket #347 (Post slug is too small to have post-slugs in non-ASCII chars) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Post Slug currently is 200 chars or so. It should be 200 _symbols_ taking in mind one thing: there are symbols above the 127 one and it takes 3 chars to represent each of the symbol above 127. (like russian, or chineese, or japaneese, etc).

item.title: Ticket #346 (print.css is missing) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: wp-header.php is looking for a missing print.css

item.title: Ticket #345 (options-permalink.php gives foreach error if no static pages) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
/wp-admin/options-permalink.php gives a foreach error:

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /home/xxxx/www/www/wp-cvs/wp-admin/admin-functions.php on line 524

Adding a static page makes the error go away.

The problem is that generate_page_rewrite_rules() grabs all the static pages from the DB, but runs foreach on them even if none are returned.

item.title: Ticket #326 (9/29 nightly prevents selecting images in Exhibit) updated
item.dc:creator: lstelie
item.description:
I confirm the problem... and the solution for exhibit use (include instead of include_once)

I don't know how the plugins are named by the system but perhaps is it possible to have a switch :

IF plugin name = exhibit then : include ELSE : include_once

modifié le : 10-07-04 12:49

item.title: Ticket #326 (9/29 nightly prevents selecting images in Exhibit) updated
item.dc:creator: thefreefood
item.description: After some sleuthing, I determined that the problem with Exhibit is caused by the change in wp_settings.php, line 81 (in 9/26 nightly), from "include(ABSPATH . 'wp-content/plugins/' . $plugin);" to "include_once(ABSPATH . 'wp-content/plugins/' . $plugin);" Because Exhibit uses a two-pane system with Javascript, the plugin calls more than one instance of itself when adding pictures to a post, causing the problem. I am not familiar enough with the backend of Exhibit to know if Exhibit can be changed to work around this limitation. I also recognize that the coding change in wp_settings.php was designed to prevent potential problems caused by loading a plugin more than once. However, I wonder if it may be better to keep open the possibility so that we have fewer errors in cases like this.

item.title: Ticket #341 (Permalink error in Oct 6 nightly) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /wp-includes/functions.php on line 1253 was removed. but When trying to manage permalinks in wp-admin/options-permalink.php, I get these two errors: still exist now.

item.title: Ticket #343 (Include a text file stating the version of WordPress) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: We actually send a filename using the proper HTTP headers to do so, so if you use those links in a browser you get a file called "wordpress-1.2.1.tar.gz" or whatever. Some user agents like wget don't seem to support this.
